Portfolio

About

I'm an energetic full-stack web developer who excels at identifying problem areas and finding effective and cost efficient solutions. My extensive hospitality background accustomed me to a fast-paced environment that demanded quick, high quality solutions with limited resources.

My interest in web development began when taking a programming course in college. General Assembly's Web Development Immersive class gave me the tools and direction I needed to explore front-end and back-end developing. I gained a strong knowledge in back-end web development and realized my love for front-end. I have a lot of fun with JavaScript and am continuously appreciative of how powerful it is.

Check out my Github in the links below...

Project 4

Toy Town is an app I created on Rails. It has full CRUD functionality. Users sign in with Twitter if they would like to create a Wishlist or vote on their favorite toys. This is a website that will be used for a small business in my hometown. You can check out the code here.

  • Client:
  • Date: February 2015
  • Service:

Project 3

VenuMenu is a collaborative project built on Rails that integrates the Songkick API. Users can log in with Twitter and search a Venue by name. The venues in the US associated with the search criteria will display along with their respective homepages (if available). Users can then comment on their desired venue. My main role in the group was integrating the API. You can visit the app here and check out the code here.

  • Client:
  • Date: January 2015
  • Service:

Project 2

Drizzly integrates the weather underground API into a Rails app. Users sign in and are taken to a page with their current location's weather and ten day forecast. They can search other cities to see the same information and save cities to their favorites for quick access. This app was a two day group effort where my main role was styling. You can visit the app here and check out the code here.

  • Client:
  • Date: January 2015
  • Service:

Project 1

Venyou is a user driven app where users who are not familiar with Boston can post their favorite artists and find venues in the area that match their music preferences through fellow user recommendations. This was my first app built using Sinatra! Check it out here.

  • Client:
  • Date: December 2014
  • Service:
